subsections.title: Origins and Vision
subsections.content: OpenAI was founded in December 2015 by a group of prominent entrepreneurs and researchers including Elon Musk, Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, Wojciech Zaremba, and John Schulman. The organization’s mission was to ensure that artificial general intelligence (AGI) benefits all of humanity. OpenAI was established as a nonprofit with a strong emphasis on ethical AI research and long-term safety in AI development.

subsections.title: Initial Funding and Support
subsections.content: At its inception, OpenAI’s founders pledged over $1 billion to support the organization’s research and mission. Significant contributors included Elon Musk and Sam Altman. The early financial backing allowed OpenAI to attract some of the world’s leading AI researchers and engineers to develop innovative AI technologies.

subsections.title: Groundbreaking AI Models
subsections.content: OpenAI has achieved several notable milestones in AI development. In 2018, it released GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer), a groundbreaking language model that marked significant progress in natural language processing (NLP). Subsequent iterations, including GPT-2 in 2019, GPT-3 in 2020, and GPT-4 in 2023, showcased increasingly sophisticated capabilities, setting new benchmarks for AI-powered applications.

subsections.title: Transition to a Hybrid Approach
subsections.content: In 2019, OpenAI transitioned from being a purely nonprofit organization to a 'capped-profit' model under OpenAI LP. This allowed OpenAI to attract more funding while maintaining its commitment to ensure safe and beneficial use of AI. The change was motivated by the high costs and resources required to develop advanced AI systems.

subsections.title: Collaborations and Partnerships
subsections.content: OpenAI has collaborated with leading technology companies, most notably Microsoft, which invested heavily in OpenAI and integrated its models into platforms like Azure and Microsoft Office apps. These partnerships have helped bring OpenAI’s technologies to a wide range of applications and users.
